message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM

This paper deals with video activity interpretation, which is a task related to computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also leverages large-scale commonsense knowledge bases to establish semantic relationships among entities, which involves natural language processing and reasoning, making cs.CL (Computation and Language) another likely sub-category. The use of prior knowledge to alleviate the need for large annotated training datasets and tackle imbalance in training through prior knowledge suggests the involvement of machine learning, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category. The paper also proposes an energy minimization framework, which involves optimization, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with video datasets, making cs.MM (Multimedia) a possible sub-category.
